en.purpose: To calculate adjusted body weight (ABW) from ideal body weight derived from the Devine formula and the patient's actual body weight in obese patients.
en.use:
Ideal Body Weight (Devine formula):

Ideal body weight (IBW) (men) = 50 kg + 2.3 kg x (height, in - 60)

Ideal body weight (IBW) (women) = 45.5 kg + 2.3 kg x  (height, in - 60)

In obese patients, actual body weight is more than the ideal body weight. To calculate dosage for medications which are weight-based, adjusted body weight is used in these patients.

Adjusted Body Weight (ABW), for use in obese patients (where actual body weight > IBW): ABW = IBW + 0.4 x (actual body weight - IBW)
en.misuse: Use Adjusted Body Weight (ABW) only when actual body weight > ideal body weight.

other_details.references: Devine BJ. Gentamicin therapy. Drug Intell Clin Pharm. 1974;8(10):650-5.
other_details.en: Adjusted body weight is calculated from ideal body weight and actual body weight, when actual > ideal.
